intro: Dendranthema longibracteatum, commonly known as the narrow-bract fleur-de-lis, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, hairy, and often have a strong aromatic scent. The showy yellow or white flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
